WebMaker is an excellent tool, but I'm not sure an extension is even necessary.

As stated on WebMaker's home page, the Web App is "Recommended: Works Offline! More features. More fun!"

There's no perceptible difference between loading https://webmaker.app/app and the Chrome extension, but factors such as network connection speed *might* affect the experience.

I suspect maintenance and updates are easier on the Web version than they are on the Chrome extension version.

By far the most awesome free Web development sandbox in the world, literally.  Why?

- Supports multiple language/syntax for the  markup, stylesheet, and scripting (Atomic CSS is just cool)
- Import / export to / from a local drive or online storage
- VIM key bindings!
- Autocode functions found in many full IDEs, like indenting, completion, folding etc.
- Built-in console for logging, debugging, etc.
- MORE!

Seriously, give this a shot -- I promise you won't regret the decision.
